    Gegen Pill: Treats diabetes and kidney issues.

    Ingredients: Three liang each of kudzu root and loquat leaf, one liang of prepared aconite without skin and navel, two liang of lead-based medicine. The four ingredients should be ground into a fine powder, combined with honey to form pills the size of a wu-tong seed. Take ten pills each time, three times a day. For those who drink rock water daily, omit the aconite in spring and summer.

    According to Master Wudao’s Experience Formula: To treat excessive drinking of water. If after drinking a hundred cups one still feels unsatisfied, and urination is oily or like apricot color. Taking this medicine for three to five days will result in a large output of urine, expelling toxins downwards, permanently eliminating the issue in ten days.

    Ingredients: Four qian of mercury, two qian of tin, grind the mercury into a fine powder; one liang each of myrrh, oyster shell, anemarrhena, bitter gentian, and fritillaria; half a liang of yellow lead powder; and half a jin of kudzu root.

    Grind the above into a fine powder. For men, use the stomach of a pig that has not borne children; for women, use one from a sow. Sew it up with hemp thread, and place one new tile over it, tied with a rope weighing one liang. Add one sheng of rough rice and another half jin of kudzu root powder. Boil in fresh water until cooked, then take out and let cool. Grind in a sand basin until mixed well, and form into pills, using the method for pig stomach pills.[117p]

    Fu Shen Wan: This formula treats internal consumption, heat and thirst, and frequent urination. It consists of equal parts of: Fu Shen, Ren Shen, Zhi Ke, Mai Dong, Sheng Di Huang, powdered Mu Li, and Huang Lian (each at one tael), with half a tael each of: roasted Huang Qi, Lian Zi Rou, and Zhi Mu, and 7.5 qian of Luo Gen. Prepare as a fine powder, mix with honey, and pound with a pestle for three to five hundred pounds, forming pills the size of a wutong seed. Take fifty pills each time, using rice drink to wash down, taken away from meals. An alternative formula includes Tu Si Zi, Cong Rong, and Shi Gao, but without Zhi Ke, Mu Li, or Lian Rou.

    Huang Qi Liu Yi Tang: This formula treats various deficiencies and insufficient vitality, palpitations in the chest, frequent thirst, or thirst that precedes sores, or thirst that occurs after suffering from carbuncles. It is advisable to take it. Use 9 qian of Huang Qi (removed from the husk) and 1.5 qian of roasted Gan Cao. Prepare one dose with two sheng of water and two jujube fruits, simmering down to one sheng, and take as needed.

    Zhi Ke Cuo San: This formula treats thirst. Ingredients include: roasted loquat leaves (hairs removed), ginger cut into slices and toasted, each at 2 qian; two large black plums; and 1 qian each of light bamboo leaves, fresh Gan Cao, and grass fruit. Prepare one dose with two sheng of water, simmering down to one sheng, and take as needed.[119p]

    Zuo Gui Decoction: This is a tonic for strong water. It is suitable for those with weakened yang and excess yin at the life gate, who experience thirst. Ingredients: 2-3 qian of cooked rehmannia (can go up to 1-2 liang), 2 qian each of yam, wolfberry, and sour jujube (use less if sensitive to sour), 1 qian of fried licorice, and 1 qian of poria. Use 2 sheng of water, decoct until reduced by a third, and take it far from meals.

    You Gui Decoction: This is a tonic for benefitting fire. It is suitable for those with weakened yang and excess yin at the life gate, who experience thirst. Ingredients: 1 qian of shan zhu yu (cornelian cherries), 1-2 qian each of fried licorice and cinnamon, cooked rehmannia as before, 2 qian each of fried yam, eucommia, ginger preparation, and wolfberry, 1-2-3 qian of processed aconite. Use 2 sheng of water, decoct until reduced by a third, and take it warm far from meals.

    You Gui Pill: It treats insufficiency of the original yang, resulting from either congenital weakness or excessive mental work, leading to weakened life gate fire, which cannot generate earth, causing deficiencies in the spleen and stomach, and symptoms of excessive thirst. Ingredients: 8 liang of cooked rehmannia, 3 liang each of fried shan zhu yu and angelica, 3 liang of slightly fried wolfberry, yellow-fried yam, 4 liang each of fried deer antler glue, steamed and processed dodder seeds, and eucommia ginger juice, 2-4 liang of cinnamon (can gradually increase to 4 liang), and 2-5-6 liang of processed aconite. Follow the previous method for pill-making, shaping them to the size of a marble. Chew 2-3 pills and wash down with hot white soup; its effect is particularly swift.[123p]

    　　加减一阴煎　凡肾水真阴虚损而成消渴等证者，宜此主之。　　生地　芍药　麦冬各二钱　熟地三五钱　炙甘草五七分　知母　地骨皮各一钱　　水二锺，煎服。

    　　抽薪饮　治渴病火炽盛而不宜补者。　　黄芩　石斛　木通　栀子炒　黄蘗各一二钱　枳壳　泽泻各钱半　细甘草三分　　水一锺半，煎七分，食远温服。内热甚者，冷服更佳。
    　　玉女煎　治水亏火盛，六脉浮洪滑大，少阴不足，阳明有余，烦热干渴，头痛牙疼失血等证，如神。若大便溏泄者，乃非所宜。　　生石膏三五钱　熟地三五钱，或一两　知母　牛膝各钱半　麦冬二钱　　水一锺半，煎七分，温服或冷服。[124p]

    Jiajian Yiyin Decoction: For cases of true kidney water Yin deficiency leading to symptoms like thirst, this should be the primary remedy. Ingredients: Sheng Di (Raw Rehmannia) 2 qian, Shao Yao (Peony) 2 qian, Mai Dong (Ophiopogon) 2 qian, Shu Di (Cooked Rehmannia) 3-5 qian, Zhi Gan Cao (Honey-Fried Licorice) 5-7 fen, Zhi Mu (Anemarrhena) 1 qian, Di Gu Pi (Lycium Bark) 1 qian. Prepare with 2 zhongs of water and decoct.

    Chao Xin Drink: Treats thirst due to excess fire that should not be tonified. Ingredients: Huang Qin (Baical Skullcap) 1-2 qian, Shi Hu (Dendrobium) 1-2 qian, Mu Tong (Akebia) 1-2 qian, Zhi Zi (Gardenia, fried) 1-2 qian, Huang Bo (Phellodendron) 1-2 qian, Zhi Ke (Bitter Orange) 0.5 qian, Ze Xie (Alisma) 0.5 qian, Xiao Gan Cao (Licorice) 3 fen. Prepare with 1.5 zhongs of water, decoct until reduced to 7 parts, take warm away from meals. For severe internal heat, taking it cold is better.

    Yu Nu Decoction: Treats symptoms of water deficiency and excessive fire, characterized by a floating and slippery pulse, insufficient Shaoyin, excessive Yangming, and symptoms such as irritability, dryness, thirst, headaches, toothaches, and bleeding; very effective. However, if there is diarrhea, it is not suitable. Ingredients: Sheng Shi Gao (Raw Gypsum) 3-5 qian, Shu Di (Cooked Rehmannia) 3-5 qian or 1 liang, Zhi Mu (Anemarrhena) 0.5 qian, Niu Xi (Achyranthes) 0.5 qian, Mai Dong (Ophiopogon) 2 qian. Prepare with 1.5 zhongs of water, decoct until reduced to 7 parts, and take warm or cold.[124p]

    　　玉泉散　又名一六甘露散。治阳明内热烦渴头痛，二便闭结，瘟疫斑黄等证。此益元散之变方也，其功倍之。　　石膏六两，生用　粉甘草一两
    　　右为极细末，每服一二三钱，新汲水、或热汤、或人参汤调下。此方加朱砂三钱亦妙。
    　　秘元煎　治三消干渴等证，此方专主心脾。　　远志八分，炒　山药炒　芡实炒　金樱子去核　枣仁炒捣碎，各二钱　白朮炒　茯苓各钱半　炙甘草一钱　人参一二钱　五味子十四粒，畏酸去之　　水二锺，煎七分，食远服。

    　　固阴煎　治阴虚滑泄，消渴淋遗等证，此方专主肝肾。　　人参随宜　熟地三五钱　菟丝子炒香，二三钱　山药炒，二钱　山茱萸一钱半　远志七分，炒　炙甘草一二钱　五味子十四粒　　水二锺，煎七分，食远温服。[125p]

    Yuqian San (also known as Yiliu Ganlu San) treats internal heat, thirst, headaches, constipation, and symptoms of plague and yellowing. This is a variant of Yiyuan San with doubled efficacy.
    Ingredients:

    • 6 taels of gypsum, used raw
    • 1 tael of powdered licorice
      Grind these into a very fine powder. Each dose is 1 to 3 qian, mixed with freshly drawn water, hot soup, or ginseng soup. Adding 3 qian of朱砂 (cinnabar) enhances the effect.

    Miyuan Decoction treats thirst and related symptoms, specifically targeting the heart and spleen.
    Ingredients:

    • 8 parts of远志 (distant will) fried
    • 2 qian each of fried yam, fried gorgon fruit (芡实), pitted gold cherry, and fried jujube seeds (crushed)
    • 0.5 qian each of fried白术 (white atractylodes) and poria
    • 1 qian of honey-fried licorice
    • 1 to 2 qian of ginseng
    • 14 grains of五味子 (five-flavor fruit), discard if sour
    • 2 zhongs of water, decoct until there is 7 parts left, take on an empty stomach.

    Gu Yin Decoction treats symptoms of Yin deficiency, slippery diarrhea, and thirst, specifically targeting the liver and kidneys.
    Ingredients:

    • Ginseng as needed
    • 3 to 5 qian of cooked rehmannia
    • 2 to 3 qian of fried dodder seed
    • 2 qian of fried yam
    • 1.5 qian of山茱萸 (cornelian cherry)
    • 7 parts of远志 (distant will), fried
    • 1 to 2 qian of honey-fried licorice
    • 14 grains of五味子 (five-flavor fruit)
    • 2 zhongs of water, decoct until there is 7 parts left, take warm on an empty stomach.[125p]

    　　　　单方

    　　消渴重者：取市门溺坑水，服一小盏，三度即瘥，勿令知之。 【《圣惠方》】
    　　消渴引饮：取瓦窑突上黑煤干似铁屑者半斤，为末，入生姜四两同捣，绢袋盛，水五升浸汁，每饮五合。【《圣济总录》，下同】
    　　消渴烦热：铅白霜、枯白矾等分为末，蜜丸芡子大，绵裹，含化咽汁。　　又方：铅白霜一两，根黄、硝石各一两为末，每冷水服一钱。
    　　消渴烦乱：黄丹新汲水服一钱，以荞麦粥压之。 【《圣惠方》】
    　　消渴饮水：用蜜陀僧二两研未，汤浸蒸饼丸梧子大，浓煎蚕茧盐汤或茄根汤或酒下，一日五丸，日增五丸，至三十丸止，不可多服。五六服后，以见水恶心为度。恶心时，以干物压之，日后自定。名神效丸，甚奇。【《选奇方》】
    　　消渴烦热：水银、铅各一两，结成砂，皂荚一挺，酥炙，麝香一钱为末，每服半钱，白汤下。【《圣济总录》，下同】[126p]

    Single Prescription

    For severe thirst: Take water from the municipal sewer, consume a small cup; after three doses, it will heal. Do not let anyone know this.

    For thirst with drinking urges: Take half a pound of black coal resembling iron filings from a kiln, grind it to a powder, mix with four ounces of fresh ginger, pound together, store in a silk bag, and soak in five liters of water for juice; take five cups each time.

    For thirst with agitation and heat: Grind lead white powder and dry alum in equal parts to a fine powder, form into honey-sized pills, wrap in cotton, and dissolve in mouth. Another formula: one ounce of lead white powder, one ounce each of yellow root and nitre, ground to powder; take ten grams with cold water.

    For thirst with confusion: Take ten grams of freshly drawn water mixed with yellow earth, washed down with buckwheat porridge.

    For thirst and water cravings: Use two ounces of honey monk (a type of herb), grind into powder, make into balls the size of walnuts, and wash down with strongly brewed mulberry cocoon salt soup, eggplant root soup, or wine; take five balls per day, increasing by five balls each day until reaching thirty, then stop; do not take more. After five or six doses, use nausea from water as a measure. During nausea, press with dry substances, and it will self-regulate in the future. Known as the miraculous pill, it is quite remarkable.

    For thirst with agitation and heat: One ounce each of mercury and lead, processed into sand; take one pod of soap bean, roast it, and mix with one pennyweight of musk ground to powder; take half a pennyweight, washed down with white broth.[126p]

    　　消渴引饮：浮石、舶上青黛等分，麝香少许为末，温汤服一钱。　　又方：白浮石、蛤粉、蝉蜕等分为末，鲫鱼胆汁七个，调汤服三钱，神效。
    　　消渴引饮：汤瓶内碱、葛根、水萍焙等分，每服五钱，水煎服。　　又方：汤瓶内碱、菝葜根炒各一两，乌梅连核二两，焙为散，每服二钱，水一锺，石器煎七分，温呷，日一服。
    　　消渴引饮：人参为末，鸡子清调服一钱，日三四服。　　一方：用人参、(艹舌)蒌根等分，生研为末，炼蜜丸梧子大，每服百丸，食前麦门冬汤下，日二服，以愈为度，名玉壶丸。忌酒面炙煿。
    　　消渴方：人参一两，粉草二两，以雄猪胆汁浸炙，脑子五分为末，蜜丸芡子大，每嚼一丸，冷水下。【《郑氏家传》】　　又方：人参一两，葛粉二两为末，发时，以燖猪汤一升，入药三钱，蜜二两，慢火熬至三合，状如黑饧，以瓶收之。每夜以一匙含咽，不过三服取效也。【《圣济总录》】[127p]

    Diabetes Remedy Brew: Blend equal parts of floating stone and blue indigo from ships, adding a small amount of musk to create a powder. Take one qian with warm water.
    Another formula: Equal parts of white floating stone, clam powder, and cicada molting, ground into powder. Mix with the bile of seven crucian carps and take three qian with broth; results are remarkable.
    Diabetes Remedy Brew: Mix equal amounts of alkaline water, kudzu root, and water plantain and take five qian boiled in water.
    Yet another formula: In alkaline water, fry one liang each of Chinese yam and vine root, along with two liang of black plum with pits. Grind into powder and take two qian mixed with one bowl of water, boiled to seven parts, and sip warm once a day.
    Diabetes Remedy Brew: Powder ginseng and mix with egg white to take one qian, three to four times a day.
    One formula: Equal parts of ginseng and the root of (grass radical) are ground fresh into powder. Form into honey pills the size of a walnut; take one hundred pills before meals with starchy soup, twice daily, adjusting for effectiveness, known as Jade Pot Pills. Avoid alcohol and grilled food.
    Diabetes Recipe: One liang of ginseng, two liang of licorice powder, soaked and roasted in male pig's bile, with five fen of brain matter ground to powder. Form honey pills the size of a water chestnut; chew one pill and swallow with cold water.
    Another formula: One liang of ginseng and two liang of kudzu powder ground into powder. When the mixture rises, use one liter of boiled pig soup, mix in three qian of the medicine and two liang of honey, and simmer over low heat until reduced to three cups, resembling black syrup, stored in a bottle. Take one spoonful each night to dissolve, no more than three doses for effect.[127p]

    　　消渴尿多：用黄连末蜜丸梧子大，每服三十丸，白汤下。 【《肘后方》】
    　　消渴小便滑数如油：黄连五两，(艹舌)蒌根五两为末，生地黄汁丸梧子大，每牛乳下五十丸，日二服。忌冷水猪肉。【崔氏】　　又方：用黄连末入猪肚内蒸烂，捣丸梧子大，饭饮下。 【《总录》】
    　　消渴引饮：白芍药、甘草等分为末，每用一钱，水煎服，日三服。鄂渚辛佑之患此九年，服药止而复作，苏朴授此方服之，七日顿愈。古人处方，殆不可晓，不可以为易而忽之也。【《经验方》】
    　　消渴累年不愈：莎草根一两，白茯苓半两为末，每陈粟米饮服三钱，日二服。
    　　消渴变水，服此令水从小便出：紫苏子炒、萝卜子炒，各三两为末，每服二钱，桑白皮煎汤服，日三。【《圣济总录》】[128p]

    Excessive thirst with frequent urination: Use Huanglian powder to make pills the size of a walnut, taking thirty pills each time, with warm water.

    For excessive thirst with slippery, oily urine: Take five liang of Huanglian and five liang of (grass tongue) Lou root, ground into powder, and mix with Shengdi Huang (fresh Rehmannia) juice to form pills the size of a walnut. Take fifty pills with cow's milk, twice daily. Avoid cold water and pork. Another method: Take Huanglian powder and place it inside a pig's stomach, steam until tender, then mash into pills the size of a walnut, and take with rice soup.

    For excessive thirst causing increased drinking: Mix equal parts Bai Shao Yao (white peony root) and Gan Cao (licorice), ground into powder. Take one qian (3.3 grams) boiled in water, three times daily. E Zhu Xin You suffered from this for nine years; after stopping medication, the condition recurred. Su Pu prescribed this formula, and he was completely cured after seven days. Ancient prescriptions can be difficult to comprehend and should not be overlooked as easy.

    For excessive thirst persisting for many years: Take one liang of sedge root and half a liang of Bai Fu Ling (white poria), ground into powder. Take three qian with aged millet drink, twice daily.

    For excess thirst transforming into water, take this to promote urination: Stir-fry three liang each of Zi Su Zi (perilla seeds) and radish seeds into powder. Take two qian, and drink a decoction of Sang Bai Pi (white mulberry bark), three times daily.[128p]

    　　消渴饮水，骨节烦热：用生芭蕉根捣汁，时饮一二合。 【《圣惠方》】
    　　消渴不止，下元虚损：牛膝五两为末，生地黄汁五升浸之，日曝夜浸，汁尽为度，蜜丸梧子大，每空心温酒下三十丸。久服壮筋骨，驻颜色，黑须发，津液自生。【《经验方》】
    　　消渴饮水：用上元板桥鲜肥麦门冬二大两，宣州黄连九节者二大两，去两头尖三五节，小刀子调理去皮毛了，吹去尘，更以生布磨拭，称之捣末，以肥大苦瓠汁浸麦门冬经宿，然后去心，即于臼中捣烂，纳黄连末，并手和丸如梧子大，食后饮下五十丸，日再。但服两日，其渴必定。若重者，即初服一百五十丸，二日服一百二十丸，三日一百丸，四日八十丸，五日五十丸。合药要天气晴明之夜方浸药，须净处，禁妇人鸡犬见之。如觉渴时，只服二十五丸。服讫觉虚，即取白羊头一枚治净，以水三大斗煮烂，取汁一斗，以来细细饮之，勿食肉，勿入盐，不过三剂平复也。【《海上集验方》】[129p]

    For thirst and drinking water, with bones and joints feeling hot: use fresh banana roots to squeeze out the juice, and drink one to two cups at intervals.

    For unrelenting thirst, with weakness in the lower body: use five liang of achyranthes as powder, soak in five sheng of fresh rehmannia juice, exposed to sunlight by day and soaked overnight, until the juice is exhausted. Form pills the size of wutong seeds and take thirty pills with warm wine on an empty stomach. Long-term use strengthens the bones and muscles, improves complexion, darkens hair, and promotes the generation of body fluids.

    For thirst from drinking water: use two large liang of fresh and fat ophiopogon and two large liang of Xuanzhou huanglian, removing the two ends and trimming three to five segments. Use a small knife to clean them, blow away dust, then grind with fresh cloth. Grind into powder, soak the ophiopogon overnight in the juice of large bitter gourd, then remove the core. Pound it thoroughly in a mortar, mix in the huanglian powder, and form pills the size of wutong seeds. After eating, take fifty pills, twice a day. If symptoms persist for two days, the thirst will surely subside. If severe, take one hundred and fifty pills initially, then one hundred and twenty for the second day, one hundred for the third, eighty for the fourth, and fifty for the fifth. Prepare the medicine only on clear evenings and in clean places, avoiding women's and dogs' sight. If you feel thirsty, take only twenty-five pills. After completing the course and feeling weakened, take a cleaned white sheep's head, boil it in three large dou of water until soft, and extract one dou of juice to drink slowly. Avoid meat and salt, and do not exceed three doses for recovery.[129p]

    　　消渴引饮，小便不利：葵根五两，水三大盏煮汁，平旦服，日一服。 【《圣惠方》】
    　　消渴引饮：虎杖烧过、海浮石、鰞鲗鱼骨、丹砂等分为末，渴时以麦门冬汤服二钱，日三次。忌酒色鱼面鲊酱生冷。【《卫生家宝方》】
    　　消渴引饮：甘遂麸炒半两，黄连一两为末，蒸饼丸菉豆大，每薄荷汤下二丸。忌甘草。【《杨氏家藏方》】[130p]

    For consuming thirst and promoting urination: Take five liang of sunflower roots, boil them in three large cups of water to extract the juice, and consume it in the morning, once a day. 【From "Shenghui Fang"】

    For consuming thirst: Grind equal parts of burned ligusticum, floating stone, fish bones from a specific type of fish, and cinnabar into powder. When thirsty, take two qian with a decoction of ophiopogon root three times a day. Avoid alcohol, fish, salty sauces, and cold foods. 【From "Weisheng Jiabao Fang"】

    For consuming thirst: Take half a liang of pan fried gansui herb and one liang of yellow bletilla, grind into powder, and form pills the size of mung beans, taking two with peppermint tea. Avoid licorice. 【From "Yang's Family Collection"】[130p]

    　　消渴不止：菟丝子煎汁，任意饮之，以止为度。 【《事林广记》】
    　　消渴饮水：凌霄花一两，捣碎，水一盏半，煎一盏，分二服 【《圣济录》】
    　　消渴尿多：蔷薇根一把，水煎，日服之。 【《千金方》】
    　　消渴烦乱：黄(艹舌)蒌一个，酒一盏，洗去皮子取瓤，煎成膏，入白矾末一两，丸梧子大，每米饮下十丸。【《圣惠方》】
    　　消渴饮水：取大(艹舌)蒌根去皮寸切，水浸五日，逐日易水，取出捣研，滤过澄粉，晒干，每服方寸匕，水化下，日三服。亦可入粥及乳酪中食之。　　又方：以(艹舌)蒌根薄切炙，取五两，水五升，煮四升，随意饮之。　　又方：用生(艹舌)蒌根三十斤，以水一石，煮取一斗半，去滓，以牛脂五合，煎至水尽，用暖酒先食，服如鸡子大，日三服，最妙。　　又方：用(艹舌)蒌根、黄连三两为末，蜜丸梧子大，每服三十丸，日二服。[131p]

    For persistent thirst: Prepare an infusion of dodder seeds and drink it as needed to alleviate the condition.

    For thirst with water: Take one tael of bellflower, crush it, add one and a half cups of water, boil down to one cup, divided into two doses.

    For excessive urination due to thirst: Take a handful of rose roots, boil in water, and drink daily.

    For restless thirst: Take one fruit of yellow cucumber, mix it with a cup of wine, remove the skin and extract the pulp, boil into a paste, add one tael of powdered alum, make into pills the size of a wren's egg, and take ten pills with rice water.

    For thirst with water: Take the root of large cucumber, peel and cut into pieces, soak in water for five days, changing the water daily. Then, pound, filter, and dry the residue. Take a spoonful diluted in water three times a day. It can also be added to porridge or cheese.

    Another method: Cut the cucumber root thinly and roast it, using five taels, and boil it in five liters of water until reduced to four liters, drink as desired.

    Another method: Use thirty jin of fresh cucumber root with a measure of water, boil down to one and a half dou, strain out the residue, then add five he of beef fat and reduce until the water is gone. Eat this with warm wine, taking a piece the size of a quail egg three times a day for best results.

    Another method: Grind three taels of cucumber root and rhubarb into powder, mix with honey to make pills the size of a wren's egg, taking thirty pills twice a day.[131p]

    　　消渴饮水：王瓜去皮，每食后嚼二三两，五七度瘥。 【《圣惠方》】
    　　消渴不止：拔谷即菝葜，(口父)咀，半两水二盏，乌梅一个，煎一盏，温服。【《普济方》】
    　　消渴饮水，日至一石者：浮萍捣汁服之。　　又方：用干浮萍、(艹舌)蒌根等分为末，人乳汁为丸梧子大，空腹饮服二十丸，二年者数日愈。【《千金方》】
    　　消渴饮水：胡燕窠中草烧灰一两，牡蛎煅二两，白羊肺一具，切晒为末，每新汲水调下三钱。
    　　消渴饮水，日至数斗，小便赤濇：秋麻子仁一升，水三升，煮三四沸，饮汁不过五升瘥。【《肘后方》】
    　　消渴心烦：用小麦作饭及粥食。 【《心镜》】
    　　三消渴病：用糯谷炒出白花、桑根白皮等分，每用一两，水二碗，煎汁饮之，名梅花汤。【《三因方》】
    　　消渴饮水：取稻穰中心烧灰，每以汤浸一合，澄清饮之。 【《危氏方》】
    　　胃热消渴：以陈粟米炊饭，干食之良。 【《心镜》】[132p]

    Dryness from thirst: Peel the wax gourd, chew two or three liang after each meal, and it will be healed in five to seven doses.

    For relentless thirst: Take the seeds of millet and wild yam, chew them, then add half a liang of water in two cups, one dried black plum, and boil down to one cup. Take it warm.

    For thirst when drinking a stone (weight): Crush duckweed and take the juice. Another method is to grind dried duckweed and roots of the tongue plant into a powder, form it into pills the size of a wutong seed with breast milk, and take twenty on an empty stomach. Those afflicted for two years may recover in just a few days.

    For thirst: Use one liang of ash from grass found in swallow nests, two liang of calcined oyster shell, one whole lung of a white sheep, chopped and dried into powder, and mix three qian with freshly drawn water.

    For thirst accompanied by frequent red urine: Take one sheng of autumn flax seeds, three sheng of water, boil it three to four times, and drink the juice, not exceeding five sheng for recovery.

    For thirst and vexation: Prepare rice and porridge from wheat.

    For the three types of thirst: Stir-fry glutinous millet until white flowers appear, mix equally with white skin of mulberry roots, and use one liang for two bowls of water, boil down and drink the juice, known as plum blossom soup.

    For thirst: Take the ash from the core of rice stalks, soak it in one he and drink the clear liquid.

    For stomach heat and thirst: Cook with aged millet to eat dry, which is beneficial.[132p]

    　　消渴饮水：薏苡仁煮粥饮，并煮粥食之。
    　　肾虚消渴难治者：黑大豆炒、天花粉等分为末，糊丸梧子大，每黑豆汤下七十丸，日二服，名救活丸。【《普济妙方》】
    　　消渴饮水：乌豆置牛胆中阴干百日，吞尽即瘥。 【《肘后方》】
    　　止渴急方：大豆苗嫩者三五十茎，涂酥炙黄为末，每服二钱，人参汤下。 【《圣济总录》】
    　　消渴饮水：菉豆煮汁，并作粥食。《本草》云：或研取汁服，并佳。 【《普济方》】
    　　老人烦渴：寒食大麦一升，水七升，煎五升，入赤饧二合，渴即饮之。 【《奉亲书》】
    　　消渴引饮：韭苗日用三五两，或炒或作羹，勿入盐酱，吃至十斤即住，极效。过清明勿吃。【《秦宪副方》】
    　　消渴饮水：用出了子萝卜三枚，净洗切片，日干为末，每服二钱，煎猪肉汤澄清调下，日三服，渐增至三钱。生者捣汁亦可。或以汁煮粥食之。【《图经本草》】[133p]

    Diabetes Drink: Cook Job's tears and drink as porridge, and eat the porridge.

    For difficult diabetes due to kidney deficiency: Fry black soybeans and powdered tianhua root in equal parts, form into pills the size of a walnut. Take seventy pills with black soybean soup, twice daily; this is called the Reviving Pill.

    Diabetes Drink: Place black beans in a cow's gallbladder, air dry for one hundred days, swallow whole to cure.

    Quick thirst relief remedy: Take three to five dozen tender soybean sprouts, coat with lard and roast until yellow, powder them, and take two qian (a weight measurement) mixed with ginseng soup.

    Diabetes Drink: Boil cowpea juice and also use to make porridge. The "Herbal Classic" states that one may also grind and take the juice, which is good.

    For elderly people with excessive thirst: Take one sheng (approximately 1 liter) of barley, seven sheng of water, boil down to five sheng, then add two he (about 200 ml) of red syrup, and drink when thirsty.

    Diabetes Drink: Use three pieces of radish seeds, wash thoroughly and slice, dry them in the sun until powdered. Take two qian daily, prepared in clear pig soup, three times a day, gradually increasing to three qian. The fresh ones can be pounded for juice as well, or the juice can be used to cook porridge.[133p]

    　　消渴饮水：干生姜末一两，以鲫鱼胆汁和丸梧子大，每服七丸，米饮下。 【《圣惠方》】
    　　消渴引饮，日至一石者：菠薐根、鸡内金等分为末，米饮服一钱，日三。
    　　积热消渴：冬瓜去皮，每食后吃三二两，五七度良。 【《食疗》】
    　　消渴不止：冬瓜一枚，削皮埋湿地中，一月取出破开，取清水日饮之，或烧熟绞汁饮之。《本草》云：作羹作虀常食佳。【《圣济总录》】
    　　消渴骨蒸：大冬瓜一枚去瓤，入黄连末填满，安瓮内，待瓜消尽同研，丸梧子大，每服三四十丸，煎冬瓜汤下。【《经验方》】
    　　消渴烦乱：冬瓜瓤干者一两，水煎饮。 【《圣惠方》】
    　　消渴不止，小便多：用干冬瓜子、麦门冬、黄连各二两，水煎饮之。冬瓜苗叶俱治消渴，不拘新干。【《摘元方》】[134p]

    For treating thirst: Take one tael of dried ginger powder, mix it with the bile of crucian carp, form into pills the size of a mung bean, and take seven pills with rice wine.

    For thirst that occurs daily with a large amount of urine: Mix equal parts of water lily root and chicken inner golden (egg) and grind into powder. Take one qian with rice wine three times daily.

    For heat accumulation causing thirst: Peel a winter melon, eat two to three taels after each meal. Five to seven degrees is good.

    For persistent thirst: Take one winter melon, peel it and bury it in moist soil. After one month, take it out, break it open, and drink the clear water daily, or boil and strain the juice to drink. The "Materia Medica" states that it is good to make soup or porridge with it regularly.

    For steam-induced thirst: Take one large winter melon, remove the pulp, fill it with powdered coptis, place it in a jar, wait for the melon to diminish, then grind it. Form into pills the size of a mung bean, and take thirty to forty pills with decoction of winter melon.

    For discomfort due to thirst: Take one tael of dried winter melon pulp and decoct it in water to drink.

    For persistent thirst with frequent urination: Use two taels each of dried winter melon seeds, ophiopogon, and coptis, and decoct in water to drink. Both the seedlings and leaves of winter melon can treat thirst, without distinction between fresh and dried.[134p]

    　　消渴烦闷：乌梅肉二两，微炒为末，每服二钱，水二盏，煎一盏去滓，入豉二百粒，煎至半盏，温服。【《济众方》】
    　　消渴饮水：用香水梨，或鹅梨，或江南雪梨，皆可取汁，以蜜汤熬成膏，瓶收，无时，以热水或冷水调服，愈乃止。【《普济方》】
    　　除烦止渴：生葡萄捣滤取汁，以瓦器熬稠，入熟蜜少许，同收，点汤，甚良。
    　　消渴尿多能食：黄蘗一斤，水一升，煮三五沸，渴即饮之，恣饮数日即愈。《本草》云：或作末，水丸服之。【《独行方》】
    　　消渴有虫：苦楝根白皮一握切焙，入麝香少许，水二碗，煎至一碗，空心饮之，虽困顿不妨。下虫如蛔而红色，其渴自止。消渴有虫，人所不知。【《夷坚志》】
    　　消渴尿多：入地三尺桑根，剥取白皮，炙黄黑銼，以水煮浓汁，随意用之，亦可入少米，勿用盐。【《肘后方》】[135p]

    Here is the English translation of the provided Classical Chinese text:

    For relieving thirst and agitation: Use two taels of black plum meat, lightly roasted to a powder. Take two qian with two cups of water, boil down to one cup, then add two hundred grains of fermented soybeans and continue boiling until reduced to half a cup. Take warm.

    For relieving thirst with water: Use fragrant water pears, or goose pears, or Jiangnan snow pears; extract the juice and boil it down with honey syrup until thickened. Store in a bottle and take with hot or cold water as needed, ceasing when healed.

    To relieve agitation and stop thirst: Crush fresh grapes to extract juice, boil it down in a clay vessel until thick, add a little cooked honey, combine, and take with soup—quite effective.

    For thirst with excessive urination: Use one pound of Coptis chinensis and one liter of water, boil for three to five times, and drink when thirsty. Drinking freely for several days will lead to recovery. According to herbal texts, it can be made into a powder to take with water balls.

    For thirst with parasites: Take a handful of the white bark of the bitter neem root, chop and roast it, add a little musk, and boil with two bowls of water down to one bowl. Drink on an empty stomach; it won’t hinder you even when tired. It will expel parasites that are red like tapeworms and relieve thirst.

    For thirst with excessive urination: Take the white bark of mulberry roots dug three feet beneath the ground, roast yellow and black until crisp, then boil with water to create a strong juice. Use as desired, and it’s also fine to add a little rice, but do not use salt.[135p]

    　　消渴饮水，日夜不止，小便数者：用田螺五升，水一斗，浸一夜，渴即饮之。每日一换水及螺，或煮食饮汁亦可。【《心镜》】　　又方：用糯米二升，煮稀粥一斗，冷定，入田中活螺三升在内，待食粥尽，吐沫出，乃收饮之，立效。【《圣惠方》】
    　　上盛下虚，心火炎烁，肾水枯涸，不能交济而成渴证：白茯苓一斤，黄连一斤为末，熬天花粉作糊，丸梧子大，每温汤下五十丸。【《经验方》】
    　　消渴无度：干猪胞十个，剪破去蒂，烧存性为未，每温酒服一钱。 【《圣济总录》，下同】
    　　消渴无度：雄猪胆五个，定粉一两，同煎，成丸芡子大，每含化二咽下，日二。
    　　消渴饮水：腊日或端午日，用黄泥固济牡蛎煅赤，研末，每服一钱，用活鲫鱼煎汤调下，只二三服愈。【《经验方》】
    　　消渴饮水，日夜饮水数斗者：用雄猪肚一枚，煮取汁，入少豉，渴则饮之，肚亦可食，煮粥亦可。【《心镜》】[136p]

    For excessive thirst and frequent urination, take five sheng of field snails and one dou of water, soak overnight, and drink whenever thirsty. Change the water and snails daily, or you can cook and drink the broth.

    Another recipe: take two sheng of glutinous rice, boil one dou into a thin porridge, let it cool, and add three sheng of live field snails, wait until the porridge is finished, and then collect the saliva to drink; it is effective immediately.

    In cases where the upper body is full but the lower is empty, with heart fire blazing and kidney water dried up leading to thirst: take one jin of white Poria and one jin of Huanglian, grind into powder, mix with Tianhuafen to form a paste, and make pills the size of nuts; take fifty pills with warm water.

    For extreme thirst: take ten dried pig bladders, cut open and burn until charred, then consume one qian with warm wine.

    For extreme thirst: take five male pig gall bladders, one liang of powdered herbs, decoct together, form pills the size of lotus seeds, dissolve and swallow two times a day.

    For excessive thirst on the winter solstice or Dragon Boat Festival: use yellow clay to mix with fire-cooked oysters, grind into powder, and take one qian with broth from live crucian carp; usually only two or three doses are needed to recover.

    For excessive thirst and drinking many dou of water day and night: take one male pig stomach, boil to extract its juice, add a bit of fermented soybean, and drink when thirsty; the stomach can also be eaten or cooked into porridge.[136p]

    　　消渴饮水：因饮酒或食果实过度，虽能食而口渴，饮水数尿，以麝香当门子酒和作十余丸，枳椇子煎汤送下。盖麝香败酒坏果，枳梖亦败酒也。【《济生方》】
    　　消渴尿多：竹沥恣饮，数日愈。 【《肘后方》】
    　　消渴饮水，小便数：以黄母鸡煮汁冷饮，并作羹食肉。 【《心镜》】
    　　消渴羸瘦：用兔一只，去皮爪五脏，以水一斗半，煎稠去滓澄冷，渴即饮之，极重者不过二兔。【《海上方》】
    　　除烦止渴：生葡萄捣滤取汁，以瓦器熬稠，入熟蜜少许，同收点汤饮，甚良。 【《居家必用》】

    　　消渴引饮不止：用蜗牛十四枚，形圆而大者，以水三合，密器浸一宿，取水饮之，不过一剂愈。【《海上方》】　　又方：用蜗牛焙半两，蛤粉、龙胆草、桑根白皮炒各二钱半，研末，每服一钱，楮叶汤下。【《圣惠方》】[137p]

    Treatment for Thirst and Frequent Urination:
    If one is excessively drinking alcohol or eating fruits, even though they can eat, they feel thirsty, drink excessively, and urinate frequently. Take musk and mix it with wine to make about ten pills, then use the decoction of bitter orange seeds to wash them down. Musk counteracts wine and spoils fruit, and the bitter orange also counteracts wine.

    Frequent Urination from Thirst:
    Drinking bamboo sap freely for several days will lead to recovery.

    Thirst with Frequent Urination:
    Use the broth from a hen, cool it for drinking, and also use it to make stew with meat.

    Thirst and Emaciation:
    Take one rabbit, remove the skin, claws, and internal organs, and boil it in one and a half dou of water. Simmer until thickened, strain and cool. Drink when thirsty; for extreme cases, use no more than two rabbits.

    To Alleviate Thirst and Calm Anxiety:
    Crush fresh grapes to extract the juice, then stew it in a pottery vessel until thickened. Add a little honey and take it as a drink; it is very beneficial.

    Fever, Dry Mouth, and Red, Painful Urination:
    Take sugarcane, peel it, chew to extract the juice, and swallow it; also, drinking the juice is fine.

    Persistent Thirst and Frequent Urination:
    Take fourteen large, round snails, and steep them in three parts of water in a sealed container overnight. Drink the water; usually, one dose is enough for recovery.

    Another Formula:
    Use half a tael of roasted snails, 2.5 qian each of clam powder, gentian, and the white inner bark of mulberry root, ground into powder. Take one qian each time, swallowing it with mulberry leaf decoction.[137p]

    1. For clearing phlegm and drinking water: Wash and dry the inner membrane of the chicken, fry five liang of trichosanthes root into powder, form into pills the size of a wutong seed, take thirty pills with warm water, three times a day.

    　　止渴生津，黑桑椹捣滤去滓，入石器中，入蜜熬膏，每取二三匙，沸汤点服如神。

    To quench thirst and generate fluids, mash black mulberries, strain out the residue, and place the juice in a stone vessel, mix with honey and boil to a paste. Take two or three spoonfuls with boiling soup, and it will work wonders.

    For thirst from alcohol: consume raw oyster meat with ginger vinegar, commonly known as rock flower.

    For diabetes: cook clams, or eat them raw with ginger vinegar, which is also beneficial.

    For the three types of thirst, take catfish salivary juice and mix with powdered huanglian to form pills, then take fifty pills with wumei soup, and thirst will diminish immediately.

    For seasonal heat-induced thirst: take a cup of fresh lotus root juice, mix with a portion of honey, and divide into three doses; this is the best thirst quencher.

    Red persimmons can also quench thirst; simply eat them.

    For diabetes: consume ripe kiwifruit after frost; regularly eating them is recommended; mixing with honey enhances their effectiveness.

    Schisandra berries are the best remedy for quenching thirst; make a drink to sip regularly, or form pills to take over time, as they generate fluids and relieve thirst.

    Corn soup that is sour is very good for alleviating thirst; it is beneficial to drink it regularly. If left too long, it becomes sour.

    For hot thirst: drink the juice of cooked barley; it can also be made into porridge or rice, and regular consumption is good.

    Another remedy: drink the ash of glutinous rice stalks mixed with water, which is highly effective.

    Another remedy: regularly eat water shield, which is very good; its juice can also be consumed.

    Another remedy for the three thirst diseases: drink broth from boiled rooster, which is clear and remarkably effective, especially if it's white.[140p]

    　　消渴：白鹅煮熟取汁饮之，肉亦可食。 【《本草》，下同】　　又方：(艹舌)蒌根和鸡子曝干，更捣为末，水服方寸匕，日三；丸服亦得。【《千金方》，下同】　　又方：取七家井索近桶口结烧作灰，井华水服之，不过三服必瘥。　　又方：浓煮竹根汁饮之，瘥止。
    　　又方：浸豉汁，任性多少饮之。

    　　消中嗜食：多因外伤痹热，内积忧思，啖食咸物及面，致脾胃干燥，饮食倍常，不生肌肉，大便反坚，小便无度。轻粉一钱为末，姜汁拌匀，长流水下，齿浮是效。后服猪肚丸补之。【《得效方》】

    Xiaoke (Thirst): Boil white goose, take the juice and drink it; the meat can also be eaten.

    　　　　针灸

    　　《甲乙经》曰：消渴身热，面黄赤，意舍主之。　　消渴嗜饮，承浆主之。
    　　消渴，腕骨主之。
    　　黄瘅热中善渴，太冲主之。
    　　消瘅善喘，气走[走　原作「是」，据《甲乙》卷十一五气溢发消渴黄瘅第六改。]喉咽而不能言，手足清，溺黄，大便难，嗌中肿痛，唾血，口中热唾如胶，太溪主之。　　消渴黄瘅，足一寒一热，舌纵烦满，然谷主之。　　阴气不足，热中消谷，善饥腹热，身烦狂言，三里主之。　　《医学纲目》曰：消渴，取玉液一分，泻见血讫，取三里泻讫如前，补玉液一分；再取关元泻讫；再取廉泉。　　又法：取金津、玉液、承浆不已，再取海泉、人中、廉泉、肾俞、气海。　　又法：小肠俞、阳池各灸之，又取廉泉出恶血方已。　　又法：胃腧、心腧、膻中各灸之。[143p]

    Acupuncture

    The "Jia Yi Jing" states: For diabetes with body heat, yellow and red face, the master is the heart. For diabetes with thirst and a desire to drink, the master is the Chengjiang point. For diabetes, the master is the wrist bone. For yellow edema with a strong thirst in the heat, the master is the Taichong point. For diabetes with good wheezing, where qi runs to the throat and cannot speak, hands and feet are clear, urine is yellow, bowel movement is difficult, there is swelling and pain in the throat, blood in saliva, and the mouth is hot with sticky saliva, the master is the Taixi point. For diabetes and yellow edema, one foot is cold and the other is hot, and the tongue is long and full, the master is the Rangu point. For insufficient yin qi, heat in the middle consuming the grain, with strong hunger, abdominal heat, and mental agitation, the master is the Sanli point. The "Yixue Gangmu" states: For diabetes, take one part of jade fluid, purging until there is blood, take Sanli and purge as before, then replenish one part of jade fluid; take Guanyuan and purge; then take Lianquan. Another method: take Jinjun, Yuye, and Chengjiang continuously, then take Haiquan, Renzhong, Lianquan, Shenxu, and Qihai. Another method: moxibustion on the Xiao Changshu and Yangchi points, and also take Lianquan to release bad blood. Another method: moxibustion on the Weishu, Xinshu, and Danzhong each.[143p]

    　　又法：承浆、然谷、劳宫、曲池、意舍、关元各灸之。
    　　　　导引

    　　《保生秘要》曰：口干导引法，左右足心，每搓三十六回，按时吐纳，津回即咽六度，数周为兼后功行之。　　运功以舌托上腭，凝悬雍穴，贯一窟凉水，渐提至口噀咽。　　又法：起涌泉水或肾水皆可。
    　　又法：想喉下一窟凉水以意提起口中或舌顶上腭，或舌压下腭，则津液自生，或升肾水，或升涌泉水。　　消渴导引法，舌托上腭，从肾处想水升至背洗，出心头复两眼看两脚底，浑身想水洗之。[144p]

    Another method: Moxibustion on Chengjiang, Rangu, Laogong, Quchi, Yishe, and Guanyuan points.

    Guidance

    The "Secret Essentials of Preserving Life" states: for dry mouth, practice the guiding method, rubbing the soles of both feet thirty-six times, and synchronizing inhalation and exhalation at fixed times, swallowing the saliva six times once it returns. Perform circulating motions while holding the tongue against the roof of the mouth, feeling the point of Xuan Yong, allowing a stream of cool water to gradually rise to the mouth for swallowing. Another method: either the water from Yongquan or from the kidneys can be used.

    Additionally: visualize cool water below the throat, lifting it to the mouth with intention, by either placing the tongue against the roof or pressing down the tongue against the lower palate, which will generate saliva. This can also raise the kidney water or the spring water.

    For thirst, use the guiding method by holding the tongue against the roof, visualizing water rising from the kidneys to wash the back, then coming out from the heart to look at the two feet, imagining the whole body being washed by water.[144p]

    　　　　医案

    　　《卫生宝鉴》曰：古台韩子玉父，年逾六旬有三，病消渴，至冬添躁热，须裸袒，以冰水喷胸腋乃快，日进肉面数盂，顷时即饥，如此月余，命予治疗。诊得脉沉细而疾，予以死决之。子玉及弟泣跪予前曰：病固危笃，君尽心救治，则死而无悔。予答曰：夫消之为病，其名不一，曰食(亻亦)、曰消中、曰宣疾，此膏粱之所致也。阳明化燥火，津液不能停，自汗。小便数，故饮一溲二。胃热则消谷，善饥能食而瘦。叔和云：多食亦肌虚，是也。此病仲景所谓春夏剧、秋冬差，时制故也。令尊今当差时反剧，乃肾水干涸，不能制心火旺于不胜之时，经曰：当所胜之时而不能制，名曰真强，乃孤阳绝阴也。且人以身为主，天令为客，此天令大寒，尚不能制其热，何药能及？经曰：主胜逆，客胜从，正以此也。治疗徒劳而已，固辞而归。遂易医与灸，不数日卒。[145p]

    Medical Case

    The "Treasured Mirror of Health" states: In ancient times, a certain Hanzi Yufu, over sixty years old and with three ailments, suffered from diabetes. As winter approached, he developed heat and restlessness, needing to uncover himself and spraying his chest and armpits with ice water for relief. He consumed several bowls of meat and noodles daily, quickly feeling hunger again. After more than a month, he sought my treatment. Upon diagnosis, I found his pulse to be deep, thin, and rapid, determining it was a terminal condition. His son Yufu and brother kneeled in front of me, saying: "The illness is indeed serious. Although your efforts may be in vain, we will have no regrets." I replied: "The condition called diabetes has many names: it is called ‘excessive thirst,’ ‘digestive wasting,’ or ‘exhaustion disease.’ This is caused by an indulgent diet. The yangming transforms into dry fire, which prevents bodily fluids from maintaining, leading to spontaneous sweating and frequent urination. Therefore, drinking leads to urination more than once. Stomach heat causes food to be improperly digested, leading to hunger despite eating, and resulting in weight loss. Shuhe mentions that excessive eating can also cause weakness, which is true. This condition is what Zhongjing referred to as 'severe in spring and summer, mild in autumn and winter,' indicating the influence of seasonal changes. Your father is currently worsening as the seasons change, with kidney water depleted and unable to control the excessive heat of the heart at a time of its strength. The classic texts state: 'When one cannot control what is usually stronger, it’s called true excess, indicating loneliness of yang without yin.' Furthermore, a person is the master of their body while external forces are temporary guests; this severe winter cannot suppress internal heat. How can any medicine help? The texts say: 'The master overcomes the adverse, while the guest follows.' Therefore, treatment would only be futile, so I declined and left. Soon after, a different doctor was consulted, and within a few days, he passed away.[145p]

    　　张安抚芸夫年四十五岁，病消渴，舌上赤裂，饮水无度，小便数多，先师以生津甘露饮子治之，良愈。消渴多传疮疡为不救，既效亦不成疮疡，亨年七十五。
    　　《丹溪心法》曰：徐兄年四十岁，口干小便数，春末得之，夏来求治。诊得两手，左濇右略数而不弦，重取似大而稍有力，左稍沉，略弱而不弦，然濇却多于右，喜两尺皆不甚起，此由饮食味厚生热，谓之痰热。禁其厚味，宜降火以清金，抑肝以补脾，用三消丸十粒，左金、阿魏丸各五粒，以姜汤吞下，一日六次；又以四物汤加参、朮、陈皮、生甘草、五味子、麦门冬煎服，一日三次，与丸药间服。一二日自觉清快，小便减三之二，口亦不干，止渴未除，头运眼花，久坐则腰疼，遂以摩腰膏治腰疼，仍以四物汤用参、芪减川芎，加牛膝、五味子、炒黄蘗麦门冬煎饮，调六一散服；及觉便多，遂去六一散，仍服丸药而安。[146p]

    Zhang Anfu's wife was forty-five years old, suffering from diabetes, with a cracked red tongue, drinking excessively, and frequently urinating. The previous master treated her with Shengjin Ganlu decoction, resulting in a good recovery. Diabetes often leads to abscesses that cannot be treated; however, in her case, she showed improvement without developing any sores, and she lived to seventy-five years.

    According to "Danxi's Heart Method": Brother Xu was forty years old, experiencing dry mouth and frequent urination. He developed these symptoms at the end of spring and sought treatment in the summer. Examination of his pulse revealed a weak and thin left pulse and a slightly rapid right pulse, showing strength but slightly heavy. The left pulse was somewhat weak but not thin; however, the weakness was more pronounced on the left, indicating damp heat caused by rich food. He was advised to avoid rich flavors, reduce heat to clear the lungs, and restrain the liver to nourish the spleen, using Sanxiao pills, ten pills, along with five pills each of Zhujin and Awei pills, taken with ginger decoction six times a day. Additionally, he was to take Siwu decoction with added ginseng, atractylodes, dried tangerine peel, sweet licorice, schizandra, and ophiopogon, three times a day, alternating with the pills. After one or two days, he felt much better, with his urination reduced by two-thirds and his mouth not dry; however, his thirst was unchanged, and he experienced dizziness and lower back pain from sitting too long. He thus used a topical remedy for his back pain and continued with the Siwu decoction, reducing the chuanxiong while adding niuxi, schizandra, and roasted huangbo, prepared as a decoction, and took Liu Yi powder as needed. When he noticed frequent urination again, he discontinued the Liu Yi powder but continued with the pills comfortably.[146p]

    　　《薛己医案》曰：一男子每劳役则食少胸痞，发热头痛，吐痰作渴，脉浮大，此脾胃血虚病。盖脾属土为至阴而生血也。彼不信，服二陈、黄连、枳实、厚朴，病益甚；服四物加知、蘗、麦冬，更腹痛作呕，脉洪数而无伦次。余先用六君加炮姜，痛呕渐愈，用补中益气全愈。
    　　大尹沈用之不时发热，日饮冰水数碗，寒药二剂，热渴益甚，形体日瘦，尺脉洪大而数，时或无力。王太仆曰：热之不热，责其无火；寒之不寒，责其无水。又云：倏热往来，是无火也；时作时止，是无水也。法当补肾，用加减八味丸，不月而愈。[147p]

    The "Xue Ji Medical Case" states: A man experiences a sensation of fullness in the chest, fever, headache, cough with phlegm, and thirst whenever he engages in labor, with a pulse that is floating and large. This is a condition of spleen and stomach blood deficiency. The spleen, associated with earth, is fundamental for generating blood. He did not believe it and took Er Chen, Huang Lian, Zhi Shi, and Hou Po, but his condition worsened; when he took Si Wu plus Zhi Mu, Bo He, and Mai Dong, he developed abdominal pain and nausea, with a pulse that was surging and rapid, yet erratic. I first used Liu Jun with roasted ginger, and his pain and nausea gradually improved, then treated him with Bu Zhong Yi Qi, leading to complete recovery.

    The Chief Administrator Shen used cold medicine at inappropriate times and drank several bowls of ice water daily. The cold remedies only increased his thirst, and he lost weight daily, with a pulse that was surging, large, and rapid, sometimes weak. Wang Taifu said: "If it’s hot but not truly hot, blame it on the lack of fire; if it’s cold but not truly cold, blame it on the lack of water." He further stated: "Rapidly fluctuating heat indicates a lack of fire; intermittent symptoms indicate a lack of water." The treatment should focus on tonifying the kidneys, using the modified Eight Flavor Pill, and he recovered within a month.[147p]

    　　州同韩用之年四十有六，时仲夏，色欲过度，烦热作渴，饮水不绝，小便淋沥，大便秘结，唾痰如涌，面目俱赤，满舌生刺，两唇燥裂，遍身发热，或时如芒刺而无定处，两足心如烙，以冰折之作痛，脉洪而无伦，此肾阴虚，阳无所附而发于外，非火也。盖大热而甚，寒之不寒，是无水也，当峻补其阴。遂以加减八味丸料一斤，内肉桂一两，以水顿煎六碗，冰冷与饮，半向已用大半，睡觉而食温粥一碗，复睡至晚，乃以前药温饮一碗，乃睡至晓，食热粥二碗，诸证悉退。翌日畏寒，足冷至膝，诸证仍至，或以为伤寒。余曰：非也，大寒而甚，热之不热，是无火也，阳气亦虚矣。急以八味丸一剂服之稍缓，四剂诸证复退。大便至十三日不通，以猪胆导之，诸证复作，急用十全大补汤数剂，方应。[148p]

    At the age of forty-six, during the midsummer, Zhou was excessively overcome by desire, resulting in distressing heat and thirst. He drank water continuously, experienced frequent urination, and had constipation. His saliva was profuse, his face was flushed, his tongue was prickly, and his lips were dry and cracked. He felt heat throughout his body, sometimes like a stabbing pain without a fixed location, and the soles of his feet felt as if they were burnt. Cold treatments provided pain relief, and his pulse was strong and unregulated. This indicated a deficiency of kidney yin, with yang not being anchored and manifesting outwardly, not fire per se. The extreme heat was significant; the cold was insufficient, indicating a lack of water, so he needed to vigorously replenish his yin.

    Therefore, he prepared a dose of modified Eight Valuable Herbs Pills weighing one pound, including one tael of cinnamon, and decocted it with water into six bowls, giving him the cool mixture to drink. After consuming half, he had a bowl of warm porridge before sleeping until evening, then took another bowl of the warm decoction and slept until dawn, after which he consumed two bowls of hot porridge, and all symptoms subsided.

    The next day, he felt cold, and his feet were cold up to his knees, with symptoms returning; some believed it to be a case of cold damage. However, I said: "It isn't that. The cold is extreme, yet the heat isn't actual heat; thus, there is no fire, and yang energy is also deficient." He urgently took one dose of the Eight Valuable Herbs Pills, which eased him slightly, and after four doses, the symptoms receded again.

    When his bowel movements were blocked for thirteen days, he used pig bile to induce them, and symptoms reappeared. Urgently, he took several doses of the Complete Nutritional Decoction, which proved effective.[148p]

    　　《医学纲目》曰：壬戌年，一卒病渴，日饮水三斗，不食者三月，心中烦闷，时已十月。予谓心中有伏热，与火府丹数服，每服五十丸，温水下。越二日，来谢云：当日，三服渴止，又次日三服，饮食如故。此方本治淋，用以治渴，效。信乎药要变通用之。[149p]

    The "Essentials of Medicine" states: In the year of Renxu, a soldier suffered from intense thirst, drinking three dou of water daily. He did not eat for three months and experienced agitation in his heart; it was already October. I believed there was hidden heat in his heart. I prescribed the Dan of Fire Palace, taken in doses of fifty pills each time, swallowed with warm water. After two days, he came to thank me, saying that on that day he took three doses and the thirst subsided; on the following day, he took another three doses, and his eating and drinking returned to normal. This formula is originally for treating lin (dysuria) but is also effective for thirst. Indeed, one must be flexible in the use of medicine.[149p]

    　　《本草纲目》曰：一人病渴逮死，有人教以糯稻秆斩去穗及根，取中心，净器中烧作灰，每服一合，汤水一碗，沃浸良久，澄去滓，取清顿饮之，即取效如神。
    　　《景岳全书》曰：省中周公者山左人也，年逾四旬，因案牍积劳，致成羸疾，神困食减，时多恐惧，自冬春达夏，通宵不寐者，半年余矣。而上焦无渴，不嗜汤水，或有少饮则沃而不行，然每夜必去溺二三升，莫知其所从来。且半皆如膏，尫羸至极，自分必死。予诊之，脉犹带缓，肉亦未脱，如其胃气尚存，乃用归脾汤去木香，及大补元煎之属，一以养阳，一以养阴，出入间用。至三百余剂，计人参二十斤，乃得全愈。此神消于上，精消于下之证也。可见消有阴阳，不得尽言为火也。
    [150p]

    The "Compendium of Materia Medica" states: A person suffering from intense thirst was near death when someone advised to slice off the ears and roots of glutinous rice stalks, take the heart of the stalk, burn it in a clean vessel to ash, and then take a dose, mixing it with a bowl of water, soaking it for a long time, clarifying the residue, and drinking the clear liquid. The effect was miraculous.

    The "Complete Book of Jing Yue" states: In the capital, there was a man named Zhou Gong from the left side of the mountain, over forty years old. Due to accumulated paperwork and fatigue, he developed a wasting illness, experiencing fatigue, reduced appetite, and frequent fears. From winter through spring to summer, he had not slept a full night for over six months. In his upper body, he experienced no thirst and had little desire for hot water; if he drank a little, it would not move through him. However, every night he had to urinate two to three liters, yet no one knew where it was coming from. His urine was thick as cream, and he was extremely emaciated, certain he would die. I examined him, and although his pulse was still somewhat slow, his flesh had not wasted away completely. It seemed his stomach energy was still present. I used Gui Pi Decoction without wood fragrance, along with other nourishing tonics, one to nourish yang and the other to nourish yin, alternating between them. After more than three hundred doses and about twenty pounds of ginseng, he was fully cured. This is a case of spirit consuming from above and essence diminishing from below. It shows that consumption has both yin and yang, and cannot simply be described as heat.[150p]
